text:
-3*
Length of series is not realistic with classroom time spent on this topic.
Content is lost in a welter of devices which distracts listener.
Format
Material doesn*t lend itself well to format used.
Format gets in the way of desired outcome.
Programs lack creative approach.
Format is not suitable for designated grade level.
Script
It is not really a radio script.
Writing is poor.
Script material is not handled with integrity.
Vocabulary unsuitable for intended grade level.
Writer seems unaware of classroom situations and teaching techniques.
Script fails to stimulate constructive activity and interests.
Script shows no feeling for people and events treated.
Script is slow getting into story.
Script talks down to listener.
Situations are too contrived.
Production
Production fails to do justice to the script.
Characters do not come to life — are not believable.
Production is insincere.
Production is too high-powered for content.
Production is too slick.
Production is overdone.
Production is complex — cluttered.
